translation.en: [Jeffrey Kluger] I like to think of it as humanity's great taunting.
translation.ja: 私はそれを 人類への嘲笑と考えたい

translation.en: Space taunts us because it's always there, it's always visible,
translation.ja: 空間は我々を愚弄する いつもそこに見え ジェフリー･クルーガー タイム誌 記者

translation.en: it's directly across the cosmic window.
translation.ja: 宇宙の窓の真向かいに 存在するからだ

translation.en: Just on the other side of the glass
translation.ja: ガラスの向こうには 大きな広がりがある

translation.en: is this great expanse that we can see, we can imagine,
translation.ja: ガラスの向こうには 大きな広がりがある 見ることや想像することは できるが 触れられない

translation.en: but we cannot touch. And that lure is irresistible.
translation.ja: 見ることや想像することは できるが 触れられない その誘惑には抗しがたい

translation.en: Throughout human history, the enormity of space,
translation.ja: 人類の歴史の中で 宇宙という大きな空の器は

translation.en: the great bowl of the sky has always inspired equal parts
translation.ja: 人類の歴史の中で 宇宙という大きな空の器は 常に尊敬 畏敬 そして死の恐怖を

translation.en: reverence, awe, and mortal terror.
translation.ja: 常に尊敬 畏敬 そして死の恐怖を 感じさせてきた

translation.en: Space is the place we have been striving to go
translation.ja: 宇宙は我々が初めて 星を見上げたときから

translation.en: since we first looked up at the stars.
translation.ja: 目指してきた場所だ

translation.en: And we have actually been going since 1957.
translation.ja: 実際に1957年から 行き始めた

translation.en: [newscaster] Today a new moon is in the sky:
translation.ja: 空には新月

translation.en: a 23-inch metal sphere placed in orbit by a Russian rocket.
translation.ja: ロシアが軌道に乗せた 金属の球体です

translation.en: [JFK] We choose to go to the moon in this decade and do the other things,
translation.ja: この10年で 月に行くことを選ぶのは

translation.en: not because they are easy, but because they are hard.
translation.ja: 容易だからではなく 困難だからです

translation.en: [Kluger] The competition between the US and the Soviet Union turbocharged the space race.
translation.ja: 米国とソ連の対立が 宇宙開発競争に拍車をかけた

translation.en: We went from a standing start, with no human being ever having been off the planet,
translation.ja: 地球外に１度も 出たことのなかった人類は

translation.en: to the surface of the moon in eight years.
translation.ja: ８年後に月面に到達した

translation.en: [Neil Armstrong] It's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.
translation.ja: 人間にとって小さな一歩 人類にとって大きな飛躍だ

translation.en: [Kluger] The Space Race 1.0 was the US and the Soviet Union.
translation.ja: 第１次宇宙開発競争は 米国とソ連

translation.en: Space Race 2.0 is suddenly the private sector saying,
translation.ja: 第２次宇宙開発競争で 突然 民間企業が言う

translation.en: "If I have the money, and I have the know-how, and I have the will,
translation.ja: お金とノウハウと 意志があれば宇宙に行けると

translation.en: I can go to space."
translation.ja: 意志があれば宇宙に行けると

translation.en: On July 11, we saw Richard Branson take his space plane 50 miles high…
translation.ja: ７月11日 ブランソンが 宇宙船を80キロ上げ…

translation.en: [woman over radio] Three, two, one, release, release, release.
translation.ja: ３ ２ １ 発射

translation.en: [Kluger] …and gave its passengers about three and a half, four minutes in space.
translation.ja: 乗客に３分半か４分 宇宙を味わわせた

translation.en: I'm an adult in a spaceship with lots of other wonderful adults!
translation.ja: 今 すばらしい人たちと 宇宙にいる

translation.en: [man over radio] …two, one.
[Kluger] Nine days later, Jeff Bezos flew over 62 miles high.
translation.ja: ９日後 ジェフ･ベゾスが １００キロほど飛んだ

translation.en: They flew passengers on an 11-minute popgun suborbital space flight.
translation.ja: 搭乗客を11分間 準軌道宇宙へ 連れて行った

translation.en: These were not small accomplishments.
translation.ja: 決して 小さな成果ではない

translation.en: What SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission is about to do is vastly more ambitious
translation.ja: スペースＸの目標は はるかに野心的であり

translation.en: and will change the game entirely.
translation.ja: 考え方を完全に変えるだろう

translation.en: For the first time, four civilians are going to space.
translation.ja: 今年９月 初めて 民間人４人が宇宙へ行く

translation.en: They will orbit the Earth for three days by themselves.
translation.ja: 今年９月 初めて 民間人４人が宇宙へ行く ３日かけて地球を周回する

translation.en: These are four non-professional astronauts
translation.ja: アマチュアの 宇宙飛行士４人が

translation.en: flying a spacecraft around and around the Earth.
translation.ja: 地球を何度も周回するんだ

translation.en: This is a hinge point in history,
translation.ja: これは歴史の分岐点だ

translation.en: and will kick the doors open to space for the rest of us.
translation.ja: 人間に宇宙への扉を 開くだろう

translation.en: [Jared Isaacman] Inspiration4 is four people with very different backgrounds.
translation.ja: 乗組員４人は みんな背景が違う

translation.en: Every person who's gonna join this mission
translation.ja: 全員がそれぞれの形で

translation.en: has to be able to deliver a very powerful and inspiring story in their own right.
translation.ja: 人に感動を 与えなくてはならない

translation.en: We represent inclusive, diverse access to space.
translation.ja: 宇宙への含有的で多様的な アクセスの象徴よ

translation.en: There have been three Black female American astronauts.
translation.ja: 米国の黒人女性飛行士は ３人いた

translation.en: I will be number four.
translation.ja: 私は４人目よ

translation.en: [Hayley Arceneaux] I'll be the youngest American to go into orbit.
translation.ja: 軌道に乗る最年少の米国人で

translation.en: Also the first pediatric cancer survivor to go to space.
translation.ja: 宇宙へ行く初のガン克服者

translation.en: When I heard that they were offering me a seat, I had a flood of thoughts.
translation.ja: 選ばれたとき いろいろ考えた

translation.en: There's a lot of risk. What happens if something goes wrong?
translation.ja: 何か起こるかもしれない

translation.en: I have a family. What is that gonna do to her or what's it gonna do to our daughters?
translation.ja: そうなったら妻や娘たちは どうなるのか

translation.en: [Kluger] It is a certainty
translation.ja: 我々が多惑星種に “サイアン･プロクター” 我々が多惑星種に

translation.en: that we will become a multi-planet species.
translation.ja: 我々が多惑星種に なることは確実だ “ヘイリー･アーセノー” なることは確実だ

translation.en: And this is the next significant step
translation.ja: これは地球を超えた世界への これは地球を超えた世界への “ジャレッド･アイザックマン” これは地球を超えた世界への

translation.en: to other worlds deep beyond Earth.
translation.ja: 次の重要なステップとなる

translation.en: And it starts now.
translation.ja: それが今 始まる

translation.en: My name is Jared Isaacman, I'm 38 years old.
translation.ja: ジャレッド・アイザックマン 38歳

translation.en: I'm commander of Inspiration4, first all-civilian mission to space.
translation.ja: インスピレーション４の 船長です

translation.en: ♪ In a most peculiar way ♪
translation.ja: ジャレッド

translation.en: [Jared] I do believe you only get one crack at life.
translation.ja: 人生は１度きりだ

translation.en: To the extent you have the means to do so,
translation.ja: 手段がある限り

translation.en: you have this obligation to live life to the fullest. You never know when it's going to be your last day.
translation.ja: 精一杯生きる義務がある いつ死ぬかわからないから

translation.en: That kind of philosophy has taken me
translation.ja: その哲学から 2008年と2009年に

translation.en: from my first two flights around the world
translation.ja: その哲学から 2008年と2009年に 記録挑戦の 世界飛行をしたり

translation.en: which were both world record attempts in 2008 and 2009.
translation.ja: 記録挑戦の 世界飛行をしたり

translation.en: It's taken me to flying airshows as part of a seven-ship formation acrobatic team.
translation.ja: ７機編成の航空ショーに 出たりした

translation.en: It's taken me to some interesting places in the world, like Antarctica, on mountain climbing expeditions.
translation.ja: 南極など世界中の 面白い場所へも旅した

translation.en: He's definitely adventurous.
translation.ja: 冒険好きです 冒険好きです モニカ･アイザックマン

translation.en: I think he would tell you he's not a daredevil,
translation.ja: モニカ･アイザックマン リスク計算が好きなので

translation.en: 'cause he likes to calculate his risks, but he is like a daredevil.
translation.ja: モニカ･アイザックマン リスク計算が好きなので モニカ･アイザックマン モニカ･アイザックマン 本人は否定しますけど 本人は否定しますけど

translation.en: [Jared] I just know how lucky I am, and a large part of it is because
translation.ja: 僕は幸運です 本業の会社経営で 成功しているので―

translation.en: I've had a very successful day job running a company that's…
translation.ja: 本業の会社経営で 成功しているので― これらのことができる

translation.en: that's afforded me these opportunities.
translation.ja: これらのことができる

translation.en: [reporter 1] Jared Isaacman had an idea that is now worth
translation.ja: アイザックマンの案は ５千万ドル以上の 価値だった

translation.en: more than $50 million. He figured out a way for businesses
translation.ja: ５千万ドル以上の 価値だった クレジット決済の時間を 短縮したのだ

translation.en: to process credit cards more quickly.
translation.ja: クレジット決済の時間を 短縮したのだ

translation.en: [reporter 2] High school dropout turned businessman Jared Isaacman.
translation.ja: 高校中退の ジャレッド･アイザックマン

translation.en: You're young, you created this great company, you make a lot of money…
translation.ja: 高校中退の ジャレッド･アイザックマン 若くして大成功

translation.en: You know, it's about opportunity.
translation.ja: 機会に恵まれて

translation.en: [reporter 3] Jared's company grew more than 2000%.
translation.ja: 会社の成長率は2000％以上

translation.en: [reporter 4] CEO Jared Isaacman is ringing the closing bell
translation.ja: ジャレッド･アイザックマン 証券取引所の 閉会ベルを鳴らす

translation.en: of the New York Stock Exchange.
translation.ja: 証券取引所の 閉会ベルを鳴らす

translation.en: ♪ Don't let it in Don't let it in, don't let it in ♪
translation.ja: “冒険家 億万長者の壁を突破”

translation.en: Jared always, like, kinda keeps us on our toes.
translation.ja: いつもジャレッドが

translation.en: Like, usually my feelings are like, "Oh, no. Here it comes." [laughs] Like, what's next? But, that's just--
translation.ja: 次に何をしでかすかと 思っているわ

translation.en: It's always been in him, like, since we started dating.
translation.ja: 出会った頃からそうよ

translation.en: [Jared] I grew up with a pretty independent, you know, lifestyle.
translation.ja: 幼い頃から独立心があった

translation.en: If I wanted to get something done, I was gonna do it myself.
translation.ja: 何でも自分でやったよ

translation.en: It's a big part of, you know, how my life ultimately shaped out.
translation.ja: それで今の自分がある

translation.en: I grew up in New Jersey, and, uh, I think I was a horrible student,
translation.ja: ニュージャージー育ちの ひどい生徒

translation.en: and I wasn't, like, happy in school, either.
translation.ja: 学校嫌いだった

translation.en: So, I made the decision I wanted to leave school early
translation.ja: 中退を決意したのは

translation.en: uh, when I was 15.
translation.ja: 15歳のときだ

translation.en: There's a pretty decent age gap between myself and my, uh,
translation.ja: 兄たちとはかなり 年の差があった

translation.en: my older siblings. They were out, kind of enjoying their lives
translation.ja: 兄たちとはかなり 年の差があった 兄たちは独立して 楽しんでいるのに

translation.en: and having responsibility, and, I'm like, I gotta raise my hand
translation.ja: 兄たちは独立して 楽しんでいるのに 僕は学校で挙手して 便所に行く許可をもらう

translation.en: to ask permission to use the restroom in high school. This doesn't make sense.
translation.ja: 僕は学校で挙手して 便所に行く許可をもらう

translation.en: So, I left high school, I took my GED.
translation.ja: 中退して 一般教育修了検定を受けた

translation.en: I started the business of what became Shift4 when I was 16.
translation.ja: 後のシフト４を16歳で始めた

translation.en: It was like a, you know, you wake up, you know, at 7:30, 8:00 a.m.,
translation.ja: 朝７時30分か８時に起きて

translation.en: then you fall asleep on the keyboard at 2:00 or 3:00 in the morning.
translation.ja: 午前２時か３時に キーボード上で寝るの 繰り返し

translation.en: And you just keep doing it over and over again.
translation.ja: キーボード上で寝るの 繰り返し

translation.en: After a couple years of doing that, I kinda remember telling my father,
translation.ja: ２年後 父に言ったよ

translation.en: like, I'm getting burned out, like, I gotta have something else
translation.ja: 燃え尽きそうだ 今は何か他のことをしたい

translation.en: going on in my life right now.
translation.ja: 今は何か他のことをしたい

translation.en: From a pretty young age, I definitely took interest in aviation.
translation.ja: 幼い頃から飛行に 興味があった

translation.en: So I went to the local airport,
translation.ja: 地元の飛行場で―

translation.en: and I went to the flight school there.
translation.ja: 飛行教室に入った

translation.en: We went up in a Cessna 172.
translation.ja: セスナ172に乗った

translation.en: This is 2004 or 2005, flying. There's no Wi-Fi. It's super peaceful.
translation.ja: Wi-Fiのない2004年ごろだ とても穏やかだった

translation.en: There's no one around to bug you and it's, I mean, it's very therapeutic.
translation.ja: 誰にも邪魔されず癒やされた

translation.en: And when I did, I was like, "Yeah, this is gonna be a thing now."
translation.ja: それで これからは これだと思った

translation.en: Once you know how to fly a single-engine propeller plane,
translation.ja: 単発のプロペラ機の次は―

translation.en: you wanna fly a twin-engine propeller plane, then you wanna fly jets.
translation.ja: 双発やジェットに乗りたい

translation.en: Once you started going down that slope, it was like,
translation.ja: そうなると次は何だ？

translation.en: well, what comes next? Ex-military aircraft?
translation.ja: そうなると次は何だ？ 元軍用機か？

translation.en: Can you fly fighter jets? And it turns out, you can.
translation.ja: それで戦闘機も乗った

translation.en: And that led to airshow teams.
translation.ja: 航空ショーも

translation.en: Jared and I met at an airshow while I was flying with the Thunderbirds.
translation.ja: サンダーバーズの 航空ショーで出会った

translation.en: That's my background, 20 years in the Air Force flying F16s.
translation.ja: 僕は空軍で20年 Ｆ-16を操縦 僕は空軍で20年 Ｆ-16を操縦 スコット･ ポティート

translation.en: And there's a lot of consistencies and comparisons to the space world.
translation.ja: 宇宙の世界とは 共通点が多くある

translation.en: Jared knew he was going to space. He just didn't know who, what, or where, when, and how.
translation.ja: 彼は宇宙へ行くと決めていた 詳細だけ未定だった

translation.en: [woman] Start.
translation.ja: 開始

translation.en: [man 1] T minus 15 seconds.
translation.ja: 15秒前

translation.en: [Jared] 2008, based on my interest in aviation,
translation.ja: ２００８年 航空に興味のある僕は

translation.en: I got an invitation to watch the Soyuz go up.
translation.ja: ソユーズの打ち上げに 招待された

translation.en: -[man 1] Five, four, three, two, one. -[woman] Prime, and lift-off.
translation.ja: ３ ２ １ 離昇

translation.en: [man 1] Lift-off of the Soyuz rocket transporting Mike Fincke,
translation.ja: 離昇のソユーズにはフィンク

translation.en: Yury Lonchacov, and Richard Garriott to their home in space.
translation.ja: ロンチャコフ ギャリオット

translation.en: [Jared] And it was amazing.
translation.ja: 見事だった

translation.en: [man 2] Flight controller standing by for contact and capture of the International Space Station.
translation.ja: 管制官が待機する 国際宇宙ステーション

translation.en: [Jared] And it actually took a space tourist up, Richard Garriott was up on that mission.
translation.ja: 観光客のギャリオットが 乗っていた

translation.en: [man] Richard Garriott launched to the International Space Station as a self-funded private astronaut.
translation.ja: ギャリオットは 自費参加の民間人飛行士

translation.en: So that was kind of my first exposure to the idea that maybe
translation.ja: そのとき僕は初めて思った

translation.en: we're progressing towards a world where it won't always
translation.ja: ＮＡＳＡの宇宙飛行士以外も

translation.en: just be NASA astronauts and Russian cosmonauts that are going into space.
translation.ja: 宇宙へ行く時代が 来るのかもしれないと

translation.en: [man 2] Garriott waving goodbye for the final time.
translation.ja: ギャリオットが 再び手を振る

translation.en: Twelve years later, in 2020, I was on a call,
translation.ja: 12年後の２０２０年 電話をしていた

translation.en: and I was talking to people from SpaceX, and it was not related
translation.ja: スペースＸの人だったが

translation.en: to me going to space, or any human being going to space,
translation.ja: 内容は宇宙飛行の話では まったくなかった

translation.en: it was a very unrelated conversation. I did make a comment that, um,
translation.ja: 内容は宇宙飛行の話では まったくなかった もっと大々的にやるときは 声をかけてと

translation.en: "Whenever you guys are ready to really open this thing up,
translation.ja: もっと大々的にやるときは 声をかけてと

translation.en: just, like, keep me in mind."
translation.ja: 僕は言った

translation.en: And this was like a closing comment on a phone call. It was like,
translation.ja: 電話を切る直前のことだ

translation.en: "Well, actually we might be a lot more ready than you might think,
translation.ja: “実はやるんですよ”

translation.en: and if you want, you have the opportunity to be the first."
translation.ja: “よろしければ 最初にどうですか”

translation.en: And I was just all over it.
translation.ja: 喜んだよ

translation.en: [man] Our mission is…
translation.ja: “我々のミッションは…”

translation.en: [Poteet] You know when Jared wants to share something.
translation.ja: ジャレッドが何か 言いたいときは

translation.en: The way he says something, it's like, "Okay, he has something to share."
translation.ja: 話し方で すぐわかる

translation.en: We were in New York for business purposes, and we went for a run around Central Park,
translation.ja: ＮＹのセントラルパークに いた

translation.en: and usually, he's on his earpiece, listening to some business podcast,
translation.ja: ＮＹのセントラルパークに いた ふだんはポッドキャストを 聞いて僕を無視する

translation.en: um, ignores me.
translation.ja: ふだんはポッドキャストを 聞いて僕を無視する

translation.en: But this time he was talking.
translation.ja: 珍しくこの時は話した

translation.en: He started to allude to the space mission,
translation.ja: 彼は宇宙ミッションを 示唆し始めた

translation.en: and I didn't fully grasp what he was talking about.
translation.ja: 僕は話が よく理解できなかった

translation.en: He starts talking about how he met with SpaceX,
translation.ja: 彼は話し始めた スペースＸとの出会いや

translation.en: and this opportunity has presented itself,
translation.ja: 訪れた機会について

translation.en: and I'm like, "Is he really talking about going to space?"
translation.ja: “現実か？”と思ったよ

translation.en: "Like, there's no way." The more and more he explained,
translation.ja: まさかと 説明されればされるほど “本気か？”と思ったね

translation.en: the more details he provided, and I'm like "Dude, are you going to space?"
translation.ja: 説明されればされるほど “本気か？”と思ったね

translation.en: And he's like, "Yup."
translation.ja: 彼は…　“うん”

translation.en: And I'm like… "Holy shit."
translation.ja: 僕は“なんてこった”と

translation.en: In a matter of a couple weeks, we go from Jared telling me
translation.ja: 彼から宇宙旅行の話を 聞いた２週間後

translation.en: he's gonna do this space thing, to here we are at SpaceX.
translation.ja: 僕たちは スペースＸ社にいた

translation.en: It was like, "This is for reals. Dude, you're going to space."
translation.ja: “本当だ お前は宇宙に行くんだな”

translation.en: "That's insane."
translation.ja: “正気じゃない”

translation.en: [tour guide] Um, I thought what we would do is start out here
translation.ja: ここから始めましょう

translation.en: with this beautiful thing, this beautiful Falcon 9 rocket.
translation.ja: この美しいロケット ファルコン９から

translation.en: Um, and this rocket is a very special rocket.
translation.ja: とても特別なロケットです

translation.en: Early on, there were talks that, like, one day he'd go to space.
translation.ja: 彼は宇宙に行くと うわさがあった

translation.en: I mean, you don't believe it when, like, somebody's telling you,
translation.ja: でも信じられなくて

translation.en: but I'm like, "All right, he's got dreams" and you kinda, like, accept them.
translation.ja: 彼の夢ねと 受け入れるだけよ

translation.en: He broke the news.
translation.ja: 彼から聞いたわ

translation.en: Yeah, I think the tears definitely came down.
translation.ja: ええ　涙がこぼれた

translation.en: All you think is, "My spouse, my husband, father of my children, is going to space."
translation.ja: 夫であり父親である彼が 宇宙に行くと思うばかり

translation.en: We don't know the risk, right? You just automatically think, like, "Wow, something can happen."
translation.ja: どんな危険があるのかも わからない

translation.en: He's always been adventurous, so… this was just on a different level.
translation.ja: 彼は冒険好きだけど これはまた別もの

translation.en: Okay, now everybody knows how to launch one, and how to land one.
translation.ja: 打ち上げと着地が 理解できたね

translation.en: And then you think about, well, the extreme other end of the spectrum
translation.ja: そしてまったく逆に

translation.en: is the families where nothing went right, they got dealt a horrible hand in life,
translation.ja: 何もかもうまくいかなかった 家族がいる

translation.en: um, and… a lot of these kids in, you know, don't even grow up
translation.ja: この子どもたちは 成長することもなく

translation.en: and have a chance to experience even 1/100th, uh…
translation.ja: 僕が経験したことの 100分の１も

translation.en: of what I've had the opportunity to experience, and it's just…
translation.ja: 味わうことができない

translation.en: it's an imbalance that's… that sucks. It's terrible. We should do something about it.
translation.ja: 不公平で…　最悪だ 何とかすべきだ

translation.en: We live? Everyone can hear us?
translation.ja: 聞こえる？

translation.en: Good, thumbs up? All right.
translation.ja: いいね

translation.en: I wanna welcome the two most significant organizations to this mission coming together for the first time:
translation.ja: 両機関とも お集まりいただき感謝します

translation.en: SpaceX, obviously, you have no means to get to outer space without all the great innovations and capabilities you brought together,
translation.ja: 宇宙技術を革新する スペースＸと

translation.en: and St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital.
translation.ja: セントジュード病院です

translation.en: And why are we doing this?
translation.ja: 理由は史上最も 成功した募金活動と

translation.en: To kick off what hopefully is the most successful fundraising
translation.ja: 理由は史上最も 成功した募金活動と 認知度向上キャンペーンを 開始するためだ

translation.en: and awareness campaign in history.
translation.ja: 認知度向上キャンペーンを 開始するためだ

translation.en: If we are going to eventually live in a world
translation.ja: 誰でも星の旅が できる世界になるなら

translation.en: where everybody is capable of going out and journeying amongst the stars,
translation.ja: 誰でも星の旅が できる世界になるなら その過程で小児がんと 闘ったほうがいい

translation.en: then we'd better fight childhood cancer along the way.
translation.ja: その過程で小児がんと 闘ったほうがいい

translation.en: The other thing is, like, the rest of the crew members
translation.ja: もうひとつ　乗組員は

translation.en: have to represent the good we're trying to do with the mission.
translation.ja: ミッションの目的を 表現すること

translation.en: We're not gonna go up with a bunch of fishing buddies. It's not gonna work that way.
translation.ja: 釣り仲間と 空へ行くわけじゃない

translation.en: Like, every person who's gonna join this mission
translation.ja: ミッション参加者は全員

translation.en: has to be able to deliver a very powerful and inspiring story in their own right.
translation.ja: 強く感動的な話を 伝えなくてはならない

translation.en: And that's where we came up with our mission pillars.
translation.ja: そこで柱を作った

translation.en: Yeah, it might make sense just to explain, like, that seat selection process and everything, you know?
translation.ja: 選択過程などを 話すと分かりやすいかな

translation.en: We wanted a crew member to represent hope,
translation.ja: 乗組員の１人は希望

translation.en: a crew member to represent generosity,
translation.ja: １人は寛大さ

translation.en: and a crew member to represent prosperity.
translation.ja: １人は繁栄を

translation.en: And there's my seat to represent leadership.
translation.ja: 僕の席は統率力を表す

translation.en: We are going out and identifying people to occupy those seats
translation.ja: そこに座る人たちを 探している 人間の最高の部分を 表す人だ

translation.en: that really represent the best of humanity.
translation.ja: 人間の最高の部分を 表す人だ

translation.en: So, for our crew member that represented hope,
translation.ja: “希望”のために

translation.en: we're teamed up so heavily with St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital,
translation.ja: 小児研究病院と手を組んだ

translation.en: I can't think of anyone better to represent the mission's spirit of hope
translation.ja: “希望”の代表には

translation.en: than a former cancer survivor who grew up
translation.ja: “希望”の代表には もとガン患者で 医療に従事する人が最適だ

translation.en: to become a healthcare professional.
translation.ja: もとガン患者で 医療に従事する人が最適だ

translation.en: And we went to St. Jude and said, "You know, surely you might know
translation.ja: 病院に行って 適任者はいないかと尋ねた

translation.en: somebody who, you know, who fits this profile."
translation.ja: 適任者はいないかと尋ねた

translation.en: We've already selected one person, uh, who's a great humanitarian,
translation.ja: １人を選んだ 人道主義者で医療従事者

translation.en: a first responder, you know, a childhood cancer survivor,
translation.ja: 人道主義者で医療従事者 もと小児ガン患者で

translation.en: treated at St. Jude, grew up to become a healthcare professional,
translation.ja: セントジュード病院で 治療を受けた

translation.en: and now is still in the fight at St. Jude again helping other kids beat it.
translation.ja: 医療従事者として 今もそこで戦っている

translation.en: My name is Hayley Arceneaux, I'm 29 years old, and I'm from Louisiana,
translation.ja: ヘイリー・アーセノー 29歳です ルイジアナ出身で メンフィス在住

translation.en: but I live in Memphis.
translation.ja: ルイジアナ出身で メンフィス在住

translation.en: -Thank you. -[clerk] All right, have a great one.
translation.ja: ありがとう いい１日を

translation.en: [Hayley] Thank you.
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: I grew up in a really sweet, small town called St. Francisville in Louisiana.
translation.ja: ルイジアナの小さな町で 育ちました

translation.en: [Colleen] She was very friendly, and she loved meeting new people.
translation.ja: 人なつこくて 出会いが大好きだった

translation.en: I'd always be like, "Don't talk to strangers,
translation.ja: 知らない人と話すなと 知らない人と話すなと コリーン･アーセノー

translation.en: don't go home with strangers," I thought she would think,
translation.ja: コリーン･アーセノー コリーン･アーセノー 言って聞かせたけど

translation.en: "That might be a nice adventure to go on…" and I was afraid of that.
translation.ja: コリーン･アーセノー コリーン･アーセノー “それ面白そう”と 思うような子どもだった “それ面白そう”と 思うような子どもだった

translation.en: That's how friendly she was.
translation.ja: “それ面白そう”と 思うような子どもだった

translation.en: [Hayley] And I just had this really happy childhood.
translation.ja: とても幸せな 子ども時代だった

translation.en: I was in dance, gymnastics, and tae kwon do.
translation.ja: ダンスや体操をやっていた

translation.en: I was in tae kwon do alongside my dad.
translation.ja: 父とテコンドーも習った

translation.en: We would go to practice twice a week together.
translation.ja: 練習は週に２回

translation.en: And at age ten, I'd just gotten my black belt,
translation.ja: 10歳で黒帯を 取ったばかりの頃

translation.en: and then, I was having pain in my knee,
translation.ja: ひざに痛みを感じたの

translation.en: and the doctor said, you know, probably an overuse injury
translation.ja: 医師は使い過ぎによる 損傷だと言った

translation.en: from tae kwon do. I took some over-the-counter meds,
translation.ja: 医師は使い過ぎによる 損傷だと言った 市販薬を飲み

translation.en: stayed out of tae kwon do for a week, felt better, um,
translation.ja: １週間テコンドーを休んだ

translation.en: but then the pain started getting worse.
translation.ja: でもひどくなったの

translation.en: Well, I vividly remember the day that I found the lump.
translation.ja: あの日をよく覚えているわ しこりを発見したの

translation.en: We were walking to the car from school, and she was kind
translation.ja: 学校の後 車に向かってるとき あの子は足を 引きずっていた

translation.en: of limping in the parking lot, and I was like, "What's the matter?"
translation.ja: あの子は足を 引きずっていた ひざが痛いと言うから 家で見てあげると答えた

translation.en: And she said, "My knee hurts, my knee hurts." So I said, "I'll look at it when we get home."
translation.ja: ひざが痛いと言うから 家で見てあげると答えた

translation.en: She was making pancakes. She said, "Let me look at your knee you were mentioning."
translation.ja: 母はおやつを作りながら ひざを見せてと言った

translation.en: She looked at it and then she gasped. And I remember she went over
translation.ja: 見た瞬間 息をのんだ おやつの火を止めに行ったわ

translation.en: to the fire where the pancakes were and turned it off.
translation.ja: おやつの火を止めに行ったわ

translation.en: She kept saying, "How long have you had that?"
translation.ja: “いつからなの？”と言って

translation.en: And she pointed to this knot on my knee, like right above my knee.
translation.ja: ひざのコブを指さした

translation.en: [Colleen] We went to the doctor the next morning.
translation.ja: 翌朝 医者に行った

translation.en: I snuck out in the hall with the doctor, and I said,
translation.ja: 診察室の外で医師に

translation.en: "Could this be something serious?"
translation.ja: 深刻なのか尋ねた

translation.en: And the doctor just hugged me. She gave me this big bear hug,
translation.ja: 医師はただ私を抱きしめた ぐっと強く

translation.en: and, at that point, I just knew.
translation.ja: その瞬間にわかったの

translation.en: She ended up being diagnosed with osteosarcoma,
translation.ja: 娘は骨肉腫だと診断された

translation.en: which is bone cancer.
translation.ja: 骨のガンよ

translation.en: We returned home, and my dad immediately looked up
translation.ja: 家に帰ってすぐ父がネットで

translation.en: osteosarcoma online and found the St. Jude website.
translation.ja: セントジュード病院を 見つけた

translation.en: In order to go to St. Jude, they have to have a protocol
translation.ja: 娘のガンは セントジュード病院の 研究対象だった

translation.en: that they're studying that type of cancer, which they were.
translation.ja: セントジュード病院の 研究対象だった

translation.en: Hayley and I flew to Memphis.
translation.ja: メンフィスへ飛んだ

translation.en: I walked in and they had the reception desk.
translation.ja: 病院に入ると受付があった

translation.en: And I said, "I'm here. My daughter is Hayl…"
translation.ja: “娘はヘイ…”と言うと

translation.en: and I just burst into tears.
translation.ja: 私は泣きだした

translation.en: I couldn't even finish saying her name.
translation.ja: 名前すら言い切れなかった

translation.en: And I remember, I just kind of stepped back,
translation.ja: 後ろに下がって

translation.en: and trying to compose myself, and I feel these arms around me.
translation.ja: 落ち着こうとすると 体の周りに腕を感じた

translation.en: And it was the receptionist, Miss Penny, and she whispered in my ear,
translation.ja: 受付のペニーさんよ 私にささやいた

translation.en: she said, "It's gonna be okay, it's gonna be okay."
translation.ja: “大丈夫よ　大丈夫”と

translation.en: "You're part of the St. Jude family now. We're going to take care of her,
translation.ja: “病院はファミリーよ” 娘さんのことも あなたのことも面倒見るわ”

translation.en: and we're gonna take care of you too."
translation.ja: 娘さんのことも あなたのことも面倒見るわ”

translation.en: [Hayley] I underwent intensive chemotherapy for almost a year,
translation.ja: １年ほど集中的な 化学療法を受けた

translation.en: and, I remember I asked a lot of questions about losing my hair.
translation.ja: 抜ける髪について いろいろ尋ねた

translation.en: I was so worried about that.
translation.ja: とても心配で

translation.en: And I remember being so worried that my dog wouldn't recognize me.
translation.ja: 私の犬が気づかないと 思ったわ

translation.en: It all started with losing little pieces on my pillowcase.
translation.ja: 最初は枕に数本が抜け落ちた

translation.en: Then it started coming out in chunks.
translation.ja: 次にまとまって

translation.en: -I think we've been in this room before. -We've been in all the rooms.
translation.ja: 前にいた部屋ね 全部の部屋にいた

translation.en: Yes, we've been in every room.
translation.ja: そうね

translation.en: [Colleen] She had 12 rounds of very intensive chemotherapy.
translation.ja: 集中化学療法を12回 受けたわ

translation.en: Her counts would drop, she wouldn't have any immunity, and, of course,
translation.ja: 数字が下がると 抗体がなくなって

translation.en: everything made her sick.
translation.ja: よく感染した

translation.en: [Hayley] I had several infections, I needed numerous transfusions.
translation.ja: 何度か感染症にかかり 輸血を受けた

translation.en: Midway through, I had surgery to remove the part of my bone that had the tumor on it.
translation.ja: 治療半ばで骨の腫瘍を 取る手術をしたわ

translation.en: -[Hayley] Come in. -Hello! Hi, Hayley, how are you?
translation.ja: どうぞ こんにちは ヘイリー　気分は？

translation.en: -[Hayley] Good. Here. It's numb. -It starts to… right here is numb…
translation.ja: いいわ　ここがしびれてる ここね？

translation.en: -But I can feel all of my foot. -Okay.
translation.ja: 太ももは大丈夫よ

translation.en: When they removed the part of my bone that was affected by the tumor, they removed the growth plate.
translation.ja: 骨を取る手術で 成長板も取り除かれた

translation.en: And St. Jude had this cutting-edge technology where they were able
translation.ja: セントジュード小児病院は

translation.en: to put in a prosthetic that could be expanded without the need for additional surgery.
translation.ja: 手術せずに延長できる 人工骨を入れた

translation.en: And, they did that. They expanded it five times.
translation.ja: ５回伸ばしたわ

translation.en: Mom, I think I'm always gonna be a centimeter longer in this leg.
translation.ja: ママ　この脚はいつも １センチ長い

translation.en: Well, you're only three-fourths of a centimeter longer right now.
translation.ja: 今は0.75センチよ

translation.en: -Oh! -Yeah.
translation.ja: あら！ ええ

translation.en: [Hayley] I was a tough kid. I didn't cry much.
translation.ja: 私は我慢強くて あまり泣かず

translation.en: I tried to keep a really good attitude.
translation.ja: いい態度を保とうとした

translation.en: Hayley made an unbearable situation bearable.
translation.ja: ヘイリーは耐えがたい状況を 耐えたわ

translation.en: I'm trying to lift my leg like my right leg, but, it's…
translation.ja: 右脚のように この脚を 上げようとしてるけど…

translation.en: I can't do that yet.
translation.ja: まだできない

translation.en: [Colleen] I had to give her a shot every night, and, I'd be like, "I'm sorry,"
translation.ja: 毎晩 注射のたびに “ごめんね”と言うと

translation.en: and she'd be like, "That's okay," like, "Don't worry about it, it's okay."
translation.ja: 娘は“大丈夫 気にしないで”と

translation.en: And I always wanted to be very strong
translation.ja: 私は強くいようとしたわ

translation.en: for her to not have to do that… for her not to have to carry me along.
translation.ja: 娘が私を気遣わなくて いいように

translation.en: You're almost ready to run a race.
translation.ja: もうすぐ走れるわ

translation.en: [Barnwell] Hayley, from day one,
translation.ja: ヘイリーは初日から

translation.en: wanted to make every day better for everybody.
translation.ja: みんなのために 頑張ろうとしていたわ みんなのために 頑張ろうとしていたわ エリザベス・バーンウェル

translation.en: [Hayley] I would go up to all the donors who were giving blood, and I would say,
translation.ja: 採血しているドナーに 言ったわ

translation.en: "Thank you for donating. If I didn't get blood and platelets, I would shrivel up."
translation.ja: “ありがとう おかげで私は縮まない”

translation.en: They even made me a little St. Jude name badge that said "Gratitude Administrator."
translation.ja: 病院の名札ももらった “感謝管理人”

translation.en: And I took my role really seriously, like, I would tell people, "I am a St. Jude employee."
translation.ja: 私はその役割に真剣で 従業員だと言ってた

translation.en: She would say time and time again, "I cannot wait to come back here and help."
translation.ja: 繰り返し言ってた “絶対に戻ってきて手伝う”

translation.en: I remember thinking, "She'll do it, if she survives this, she'll do it."
translation.ja: 彼女ならきっとやると 私は思った

translation.en: -[Hayley] My scans are clean? -Yes.
translation.ja: 影はなし？ ええ

translation.en: -Yay! -Woohoo!
translation.ja: やった！

translation.en: [Hayley] My first reaction to when I had cancer was I'm going to die.
translation.ja: ガンになったときは 死ぬと思った

translation.en: And I haven't died.
translation.ja: でも死んでない

translation.en: And I'm not going to die.
translation.ja: 絶対 死なないわ

translation.en: Spaghetti!
translation.ja: スパゲティ

translation.en: I come back every two months now for a check-up because I'm in remission.
translation.ja: ２か月に１回 検査に来るの 寛解期なのよ

translation.en: That means the cancer is gone.
translation.ja: ガンが消えたの

translation.en: [man] Your hair looks a little different.
translation.ja: 髪型が違う

translation.en: [Hayley] I just love St. Jude.
translation.ja: セントジュード大好き

translation.en: My dream is to be a nurse there.
translation.ja: そこの看護師になりたい

translation.en: [Hayley] I applied for a job in 2019 with in-patient leukemia at St. Jude.
translation.ja: 2019年 白血病病棟に 応募した

translation.en: I just knew that this was my team, these were my people.
translation.ja: そこが私の場所だと思った

translation.en: -Hi, Hayley, how you doing? -I'm good, how are you?
translation.ja: 元気？ ええ

translation.en: When I got that email that I got the job, I could not stop crying.
translation.ja: 合格通知を受けたときは 泣いたわ

translation.en: I called my mom, and I was just bawling crying, and she was like,
translation.ja: 母に電話して ただ大泣きしてたら

translation.en: "Hayley, stop crying. I don't know what you're saying."
translation.ja: “泣きやんで　何なの？”

translation.en: And I was like, "I got a job!" [laughs]
translation.ja: “採用よ！”

translation.en: That was the happiest moment of my life.
translation.ja: 最高に幸せだった

translation.en: I'm Hayley. It's nice to meet you.
translation.ja: ヘイリーよ　こんにちは

translation.en: I heard a lot of really cool things about you.
translation.ja: いい子だって聞いたわ

translation.en: Getting to interact with these kids and getting to show them
translation.ja: 子どもたちに ガン克服後の人生を

translation.en: what their life can look like after cancer, it's introduced me to the best people.
translation.ja: 見せることで すばらしい出会いがあった

translation.en: You know, whenever I was younger, I was a patient here.
translation.ja: 子どもの頃 私も患者だったの

translation.en: I was treated for bone cancer.
translation.ja: 骨のガンよ

translation.en: Having cancer made me who I am.
translation.ja: ガンのおかげで 今の私がある

translation.en: And you can totally do this. If I can do it, you can definitely do it.
translation.ja: あなたにも できるわ

translation.en: [boy] Thank you for telling me.
translation.ja: 話をありがとう

translation.en: [Hayley] Aw. It was so good to meet you. You're awesome.
translation.ja: 会えてよかった　いい子ね

translation.en: It definitely changed my life for the better.
translation.ja: いい人生にしてくれた

translation.en: And then, in early January, St. Jude sent me an email
translation.ja: １月初め セントジュードが メールで

translation.en: saying they wanted to talk to me about a unique opportunity.
translation.ja: 面白い話があると 言ってきた

translation.en: And so I went into this phone call, almost a little nervous.
translation.ja: 最初は緊張してたわ

translation.en: I was just thinking, "What are they gonna ask?"
translation.ja: 何を聞かれるのかと

translation.en: There's two people on the call, and one says to the other,
translation.ja: ２人のうちの１人が

translation.en: "All right, do you wanna explain it? Blast off?"
translation.ja: “じゃあ 爆弾発言を”

translation.en: And I remember going, "Blast off?"
translation.ja: “爆弾発言”？

translation.en: And then, they start telling me about Jared
translation.ja: 彼らはジャレッドと 宇宙ミッションの話をしたわ

translation.en: and this all-civilian mission to space. And they absolutely shocked me
translation.ja: 彼らはジャレッドと 宇宙ミッションの話をしたわ 私は行くかと聞かれて すごく驚いた

translation.en: when they asked if I wanted to go.
translation.ja: 私は行くかと聞かれて すごく驚いた

translation.en: And I looked down, my hands were shaking, I just couldn't believe it.
translation.ja: 驚がくして手が震えてた

translation.en: And then I thought, you know, "Let me check with my mom."
translation.ja: 母に話そうと思った

translation.en: Hayley called me, she said, "Mom, you're never gonna believe that,
translation.ja: ヘイリーが電話で “聞いて”

translation.en: but it's true." She said, "They want me to go to space."
translation.ja: “宇宙へ行けるの”

translation.en: I said, "What?" And then I did ask her, like,
translation.ja: 私は“え？”と思って 聞いた

translation.en: "Oh, well… how many astronauts are going?"
translation.ja: “宇宙飛行士は何人？”

translation.en: And that's when she said, "None."
translation.ja: 娘の答えは“ゼロ”

translation.en: And I said, "Why don't you call Hayden?"
translation.ja: “ヘイデンに電話したら？”

translation.en: Her brother, who's the airspace engineer. I said, "Let's see what Hayden says."
translation.ja: 航空エンジニアの息子よ “意見を聞こう”

translation.en: And Hayden has always been the space boy.
translation.ja: ヘイデンはいつも 宇宙少年だった

translation.en: We went to NASA several times over the years, mostly because of his love for space.
translation.ja: だからＮＡＳＡへ 何度も行ったわ

translation.en: He was at work that day, and I called him and I was like,
translation.ja: 仕事中の弟に電話をかけて

translation.en: "You've gotta go outside, this is an emergency."
translation.ja: “外へ出て　緊急よ”

translation.en: I go out and sit in this little, like, uh,
translation.ja: 僕は外へ出て

translation.en: area that's separated from everyone and call,
translation.ja: 人から離れて ヘイデン･アーセノー

translation.en: I Facetime her, have my Airpods in so no one can hear, luckily.
translation.ja: ヘイデン･アーセノー ヘイデン･アーセノー フェイスタイムした

translation.en: She's like, "I don't know how to tell you this,
translation.ja: ヘイデン･アーセノー ヘイデン･アーセノー “ヘイデン 私 宇宙へ行くの” “ヘイデン 私 宇宙へ行くの”

translation.en: but I'm going to space." And I was like, "Space?"
translation.ja: “ヘイデン 私 宇宙へ行くの” “宇宙？　医師助手が？ どうして？”

translation.en: "Wait, wait, you're going to space? Aren't you a PA? What? What's going on?"
translation.ja: “宇宙？　医師助手が？ どうして？”

translation.en: I was… I was shocked.
translation.ja: 僕は驚いたよ

translation.en: I never thought in a million years she would get the opportunity to go to space, right?
translation.ja: 姉が宇宙へなんて 想像もしなかった

translation.en: And I said, "I wanna do it," and he said, "You should do it."
translation.ja: 行きたいと言うと 行けと言った

translation.en: And, I emailed St. Jude and I said, "I accept."
translation.ja: セントジュードに メールで受諾を知らせた

translation.en: And I said, "I do have a couple questions. Are we going to the moon?"
translation.ja: そして月へ行くのかと尋ねた

translation.en: I was like, "Did you ask questions, like, how high are you going up, like, what's the plan?"
translation.ja: 高度とか いろいろ 質問したかと聞くと

translation.en: And she was like, "Yeah, I emailed them, asked them, are we going to the moon?"
translation.ja: 姉は“月へ行くのか尋ねた”

translation.en: And I was like, "Hayley, I guarantee you're not going to the moon."
translation.ja: “月は絶対ない”と 僕は答えた

translation.en: And I was dying to tell people.
translation.ja: 人に言いたくて たまらなかった

translation.en: -How are you? -[woman on computer] Good, how are you?
translation.ja: 元気？ ええ　あなたは？

translation.en: I'm good! I have some really big news, but it's a secret.
translation.ja: 元気 秘密の大ニュースがあるの

translation.en: -Yeah? You're freaking me out. -[laughs] It's good news!
translation.ja: 心配だわ いい話よ

translation.en: -Do y'all have any guesses? -Okay, did you get promoted at work?
translation.ja: 当ててみる？ 仕事で昇進？

translation.en: [Hayley] It's a lot bigger than that!
translation.ja: それよりすごいの

translation.en: -Um… -What is it?
translation.ja: 何？

translation.en: Okay. Winning a trip to outer space.
translation.ja: 宇宙旅行が当たったの

translation.en: -Are you going? -I'm going to outer space.
translation.ja: 行くの？ 宇宙に行くわ

translation.en: No, you're not.
translation.ja: ウソでしょ

translation.en: -What? Hayley! -I'm gonna be an astronaut.
translation.ja: え？　ヘイリー！ 宇宙飛行士よ

translation.en: I'm gonna know a freaking astronaut. Dude, we're gonna know
translation.ja: 私たちが 宇宙飛行士と知り合い？

translation.en: -a freaking astronaut! -And, of course, I want y'all to…
translation.ja: 私たちが 宇宙飛行士と知り合い？ みんなで…

translation.en: -That is so cool! -I want y'all to be there
translation.ja: すごい！ 打ち上げに来て

translation.en: -at the launch. -Yes! I wanna be there at the freaking launch!
translation.ja: もちろん 行くわ！

translation.en: Y'all, can y'all believe I'm going to f… outer space?
translation.ja: 宇宙なんて信じられる？

translation.en: [woman on phone] No, like, our best friend is going to space. What?
translation.ja: 親友が宇宙へ行くなんて ウソみたい

translation.en: And then a few days later, I got to Zoom with Jared for the first time.
translation.ja: 数日後 初めて ジャレッドと話した

translation.en: He went through Inspiration4, and, um, gave me all the information,
translation.ja: インスピレーション４を 説明して 質問に答えてくれた

translation.en: -answered all my questions. -[man] Showed you where the moon was.
translation.ja: 質問に答えてくれた 月の位置も

translation.en: [laughs] He said we were not going to the moon.
translation.ja: 月へは行かないと

translation.en: Apparently, people haven't gone there in decades. -No… -I learned that.
translation.ja: 人は数十年 行ってないそうよ

translation.en: Yeah, so we had a great call,
translation.ja: いい会話だったわ

translation.en: I was feeling so good about it. And the next week,
translation.ja: いい会話だったわ 翌週 スペースＸへ行った

translation.en: we were on our way to SpaceX.
translation.ja: 翌週 スペースＸへ行った

translation.en: [Jared] Hayley obviously represents our mission pillar of hope.
translation.ja: ヘイリーは当然 “希望”を表す

translation.en: I told them, I said, "I'm dying to tell my patients."
translation.ja: 患者に言いたいと言ったの

translation.en: [Jared] Her official role in the mission is she's our medical officer,
translation.ja: 彼女の公式任務は医務官だ

translation.en: and who could be better qualified than that? She's a physician assistant.
translation.ja: 医師助手だから適任だろ？

translation.en: But she does bring a lot more than that too.
translation.ja: それ以外にもある

translation.en: She's got toughness.
translation.ja: 彼女はタフだ

translation.en: She faced a circumstance that could have ended very poorly, like none of us have experienced, you know, at ten years old.
translation.ja: 最悪となり得る状況に 10歳のときに直面し

translation.en: She overcame that.
translation.ja: 克服した

translation.en: Mila, Liv, do you guys know that Hayley is gonna be an astronaut?
translation.ja: ヘイリーは 宇宙飛行士になるよ

translation.en: -Yes. -We're gonna go to space together.
translation.ja: うん 宇宙に行くの

translation.en: -[Jared] Isn't that cool? -Yeah.
translation.ja: すごいね うん

translation.en: I do think that in life, you should say yes to opportunities that scare you.
translation.ja: 人生では怖いことも 受け入れるべきと思う

translation.en: [tour guide] Welcome to the production floor!
translation.ja: 製作の階だよ

translation.en: This thing above me is…
translation.ja: 頭上にあるのは 古いドラゴンカプセル

translation.en: the old version of the Dragon Capsule, but this is not the version
translation.ja: 頭上にあるのは 古いドラゴンカプセル でも君たちが乗るのは フェラーリだ

translation.en: you're gonna fly in. You're getting a Ferrari. Yeah.
translation.ja: でも君たちが乗るのは フェラーリだ

translation.en: At the bottom, are there engines that are propelling us at…?
translation.ja: 底にあるエンジンの…

translation.en: What is the speed?
translation.ja: 速度は？

translation.en: Roughly 25 times the speed of sound, or 17,500 miles an hour.
translation.ja: 音の約25倍 時速だと２万８千キロだ

translation.en: -Oh, wow. -Yeah. It's, uh, kinda crazy.
translation.ja: まあ！ ああ　すごいだろ

translation.en: I think such a beautiful part of life is you don't know
translation.ja: 人生で美しいのは 予測がつかないこと

translation.en: what's around the corner. That's why you hold on to hope
translation.ja: 人生で美しいのは 予測がつかないこと だから希望を持つ

translation.en: that there's gonna be better days.
translation.ja: だから希望を持つ

translation.en: [Jared] This is where we're gonna… we're gonna live for three days.
translation.ja: ここで３日間過ごす

translation.en: [Hayley] Home sweet home!
translation.ja: 楽しい我が家

translation.en: You know, this is awesome.
translation.ja: すごいわ

translation.en: ♪ …is you ♪
translation.ja: 打ち上げまで２２７日

translation.en: We will head up to the training center,
translation.ja: 訓練センターで

translation.en: where you'll get your suit measurements taken.
translation.ja: 宇宙服の採寸よ

translation.en: They'll be the most in-depth set of measurements you'll ever have.
translation.ja: とても細かくね

translation.en: [Hayley] Until this mission, these NASA astronauts,
translation.ja: ＮＡＳＡの宇宙飛行士は

translation.en: they've been perfect, god-like specimens.
translation.ja: 完ぺきで神のような 存在だった

translation.en: Physically perfect, brilliant, strong…
translation.ja: 完全な体型 頭脳明せきで 体力がある

translation.en: [man] And knee depth.
translation.ja: ひざは？

translation.en: [Hayley] This'll probably be the larger knee.
translation.ja: 大きめのひざね

translation.en: I'm going to space not physically perfect. With this rod in my leg,
translation.ja: 私の体は完ぺきではないわ 棒が入った脚は 失格になるところよ

translation.en: I would have immediately been disqualified.
translation.ja: 棒が入った脚は 失格になるところよ

translation.en: I'll be the first person with a prosthetic body part to go to space.
translation.ja: 一部人工の体で 宇宙へ行くのは私が初めて

translation.en: They don't know exactly how it's gonna go.
translation.ja: それが成功するかどうか

translation.en: Now we're gonna find out.
translation.ja: じきに分かる

translation.en: [Kluger] The presumption for space travel has always been,
translation.ja: 宇宙旅行の前提は常に

translation.en: "No, you are not qualified."
translation.ja: “君に行く資格はない”

translation.en: "It is up to you to prove to me that you are qualified to go."
translation.ja: “資格があることを 証明してみろ”

translation.en: John Glenn… Jim Lovell…
translation.ja: ジョン・グレン ジム・ラベル

translation.en: Neil Armstrong… Sally Ride…
translation.ja: ニール・アームストロング サリー・ライド

translation.en: Mae Jemison…
translation.ja: メイ・ジェイミソン

translation.en: They were different from you and me.
translation.ja: 彼らは別格だった

translation.en: But these folks, the Inspiration4 crew…
translation.ja: インスピレーション４の 乗組員は

translation.en: these people are you and me.
translation.ja: 我々のような人間だ

translation.en: I can't wait to meet numbers three and four.
translation.ja: 他の２人に会いたい

translation.en: If you think about it, there are two random people going about their lives
translation.ja: すごいよね 今 何も知らない人が

translation.en: and 30 days from now, they're gonna get fitted for a spacesuit.
translation.ja: 30日後 宇宙服の採寸を するんだ

translation.en: This mission will open a different dimension in who gets to fly.
translation.ja: このミッションは誰が 宇宙へ行くか別の次元を開く

translation.en: And in that sense, this is one of the most important missions ever flown.
translation.ja: その意味でこれは 最重要なミッションだ
